column3: The will to persevere is often the difference between failure and success.
My great concern is not whether you have failed, but whether you are content with your failure.
A failure is not always a mistake, it may simply be the best one can do under the circumstances. The real mistake is to stop trying.
Do not fear mistakes. You will know failure. Continue to reach out.
Failure is not a single, cataclysmic event. You don't fail overnight. Instead, failure is a few errors in judgement, repeated every day.
A man can fail many times, but he isn't a failure until he begins to blame somebody else.

Failure should be our teacher, not our undertaker. Failure is delay, not defeat. It is a temporary detour, not a dead end. Failure is something we can avoid only by saying nothing, doing nothing, and being nothing.
Failure is a detour, not a dead-end street.
Every failure is a step to success.
Don't be afraid of failure; be afraid of petty success.
Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
Success is simply a matter of luck. Ask any failure.
Failure is success if we learn from it.
Rather than viewing a brief relapse back to inactivity as a failure, treat it as a challenge and try to get back on track as soon as possible.
I have a tendency to sabotage relationships; I have a tendency to sabotage everything. Fear of success, fear of failure, fear of being afraid. Useless, good-for-nothing thoughts.
Without failure there is no achievement.
The majority of men meet with failure because of their lack of persistence in creating new plans to take the place of those which fail.

Creative risk taking is essential to success in any goal where the stakes are high. Thoughtless risks are destructive, of course, but perhaps even more wasteful is thoughtless caution which prompts inaction and promotes failure to seize opportunity.
While it is important for people to see your promise you must also remember that hope is the keeper of both happiness and disappointment, the father of both progress and failure.
Tragedy in life normally comes with betrayal and compromise, and trading on your integrity and not having dignity in life. That's really where failure comes.

Well, I think that there's a very thin dividing line between success and failure. And I think if you start a business without financial backing, you're likely to go the wrong side of that dividing line.
In tennis, it is not the opponent you fear, it is the failure itself, knowing how near you were but just out of reach.
We dissect failure a lot more than we dissect success.

When I was growing up, Brandy was TV star, reality star, a pop star, a Cover girl, Grammy winner, had her own Brandy doll, and was the first African American to play Disney princess Cinderella. Most importantly, she is a survivor. Many only judge and remember a person's most recent failure.
Success is more difficult to handle than failure.

Our failure as a society to properly acknowledge and confront the psychological, social, and political effects of white privilege has perpetuated racial inequality and race-based political resentments.
